string_table.name: npxnabnsnfns11111101101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

slidelink.displaytext: When breaking news happens, where do you go to find information?
Where did you get your news last week?
Aspects to Consider When Reviewing a Source

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: <Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Welcome to Temple University Libraries Analytical Reading & Writing online module!" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Where did you get your news last week?" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="The News Study conducted by Project Information Literacy determined the statistics. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="For additional details, visit https://www.projectinfolit.org/news_study.html.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Alison J. Head, John Wihbey, P. Takis Metaxas, Margy MacMillan, and Dan Cohen, “How Students Engage with News: Five Takeaways for Educators, Journalists, and Librarians,” Project Information Literacy Research Institute. (October 16, 2018)." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="When you’re asked to use outside sources in a paper, it can be difficult to figure out where to find sources and whether they are appropriate for academic research.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="To begin, it may be helpful to think about the variety of source types you might use, and which you’re likely to find based on the nature of your topic.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Let’s walk through the Information Timeline. Click each tab to the right to learn more." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Drag and drop the usage description with the corresponding source type." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="While knowing the characteristics of sources types is helpful, it is also important to consider how you use your sources. Any type of source might be appropriate for a research project, depending on how you use it. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Let’s take a look at the BEAM method, developed by Joseph Bizup.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click each to learn more." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="You should now have an understanding of the information timeline, source types and their uses, the library website and databases, and the research process." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Contact a librarian for additional help!" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Let us know what you think by clicking the link to provide your feedback." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Thank you!" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
